intro: Clarkia amoena subsp. lindleyi, commonly known as Lindley's Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly smaller flowers and more compact growth habit compared to the main species.
